item.title: HOME
item.content:encoded:
jackson's best ride

highest quality bicycle service in the Tetons

item.title: CONTACT
item.content:encoded:
Located in Jackson Hole, The HUB is a purveyor of fine bicycles for on the road and off.

Photos by 

 

 

For special inquiries please call or email for appointment:

307.200.6144

info@thehubbikes.com

 

Phone

307.200.6144

 

Location

1160 Alpine Lane
Jackson Hole, Wyoming 83001

 

Hours

T-F 11a–6p
Sa 10a–4p
Su-M We ride

item.title: PEOPLE
item.content:encoded:
We are group of committed athletes who call the outdoors home, this is essential to the culture of our shop. We pride ourselves on offering the highest quality bicycle service in the Tetons. With our shop in the heart of Jackson Hole we are never far from reach. Every bike brought to the shop is attended to by one of our experienced mechanics. We understand your bike means a lot to you and treat it as if it were your own.

STAFF

Featured
May 4, 2016 Adam Grove
May 4, 2016 Adam Grove
May 4, 2016 Adam Grove
May 4, 2016 Adam Grove

AARON GRUTZMACHER

Role: Retail Martyr

Info: Aaron grew up dragging his family members on adventures of all kind. After racing bikes in high school, he escaped the Midwest for the Rocky Mountains. In Steamboat Springs, he talked his way into a job at Sore Saddle Cyclery (where he met Pedar, the creator of Moots, the future founder of Dirty Fingers, and master mechanic Rich Takasui). Sore Saddle's owner described Jackson Hole's beauty and biking so Aaron headed there next. The Hub started in a garage, moved to a ski boot corner in a ski shop, and finally settled into a custom fabricated jackson location. 

Hometown: Cincinnati, OH

Bikes: Cannondale slate, GT Fury, Felt Outfitter, 1980s Ibis tandem with rainbow splatter paint (custom)

Favorite Jackson Ride: Phillips Canyon, Lithium Trail

Other Sports: Skiing, Snowmobiling, extreme SUPing

Bucket List Ride: New Zealand

May 4, 2016 Adam Grove
May 4, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove

PEDAR ENGER

Role: head service mechanic

Info: Pedar and Aaron met while working at Sore Saddle Cyclery, and, "it all went downhill from there." Born and raised on the Wyoming range just like Davey Crockett, Pedar Enger is a master of all Jackson seasons and an expert camp cook. This mountain man joined The Hub in 2013. Pedar is a seasoned bike mechanic with over 10 years of lead-mechanic experience - which qualifies him to ride two bikes at once while holding an ice cream cone. 

Hometown: Jackson Hole, WY

Bikes: Mountain, Road

Favorite Jackson Ride: Denali National Park

Other Sports: Skiing, Snowboarding, Surfing

Bucket List Ride:

May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

RUSTY REYNOLDS

Role: service mechanic

Info: Rusty grew up in central Wyoming chasing antelope on his bike. He worked on bikes for seven years to put himself through college;  graduating with an official degree in bike-ology. Rusty apprenticed at Casper Mountain Sports, then found his way into the Pedal House in Laramie, Wyoming (where he and Pedar became blood brothers). Rusty likes people so ask him questions. 

Hometown: Casper, WY

Bikes: Ibis mojo 3, Cannondale Trigger Team, Schwinn Stingray with rams horn bars

Favorite Jackson Ride: Josie's Ridge

Other Sports: Rock climbing, boxing, skiing, hunting

Bucket List Ride: Peru

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

IAN HANEY

Role: Suspension Guru

Info: Ian was raised in Moab, UT with his outdoorsy family (off the grid, definitely no cable TV). His family spent some years in Grand Junction, where he developed his loves for digging trail and riding, and worked at Grass Roots Cycles. While visiting friends and riding in Jackson, Ian found himself moonlighting with the Hub mechanics on a busy summer day. He proved his excellent mechanical skills and secured a standing invitation to join the team if he wanted to move to Wyoming. He's been with the Hub since January, 2016. 

Hometown: Grand Junction, CO

Bikes: long travel trail to downhill, Transition

Favorite Jackson Ride: Lithium Trail

Other Sports: Snowboarding, shooting photos and guns

Bucket List Ride: Queenstown, NZ

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

HAL WHEELER

Role: Logistical Monkey

Info: Hal grew up outside of Boston, MA and rode bikes everywhere as a kid. His father introduced him to Mountain Bikes in the 90s, when everyone rode fully rigid bikes around the root filled trails. Once he got front suspension and moved to Colorado he decided Mountain biking was a good time. Hal moved to Jackson for the skiing, and was fortunate enough to meet Aaron in the early days of The Hub. He hung around the shop long enough that he was eventually offered a job, and has been with the Hub since November 2015.

Hometown: Weston, MA

Bikes: Transition Smuggler, Ibis Mojo 3;  Cannondale Flying V (Missy Giove's bike)

Favorite Jackson Ride: Phillips Canyon 

Other Sports: Skiing, paddle boarding, surfing

Bucket List Ride: Trans-Provence

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove

MICHELLE SIROIS

Role: Customer Magician

Info: 

Hometown: Boston, MA

Bikes: Cannondale Habit

Favorite Jackson Ride: Ferrins

Other Sports: Backcountry skiing, Running

Bucket List Ride: Somewhere overlooking the ocean where a glass of wine is waiting for me!

Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

DUSTIN VARGA

Role: Shop Mascot, Sales Swami

Info: Dust grew up in rural Indiana, moved to Jackson 26 years ago. Always raced road bikes, followed the European pro cycling scene, lived in France, seen a couple of Tours live, ridden Alp D'huez, and loves getting people stoked on riding all kinds of bikes! 

Hometown: No Hometown, Rural Indiana... (seriously lived on a country road)

Bikes: Pinarello Dogma F8, All Steel Vintage Italian road bikes

Favorite Jackson Ride: Riding the Pass and the Buttes

Other Sports:  Snowboarding, climbing, moto, sleds, fishing

Bucket List Ride: Monte Crostis, Italy

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove

DYLAN SPENCE

Role: Super Intern

Info: Dylan was raised in Northwest Wyoming and has returned for a summer of extreme bicycle apprenticeship. He loves riding trails in the Tetons as well as the Pacific Northwest during the school year.

Hometown: Jackson Hole, WY

Bikes: Cannondale Jekyll

Favorite Jackson Ride: Black Canyon

Other Sports: Skiing, Hiking

Bucket List Ride: Chile

May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 20, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

NONI PITTENGER

Role: Events + Design Coordination

Info: Noni founded the Hub design studio around 2011. After toiling over jersey layouts she went off to earn a master's degree, and now can draft event posters and t-shirt art way faster. As a child, she was in a pretty fierce suburban street rollerblading and bicycling gang with her three brothers. Now she loves riding cross country all over Jackson and in Sun Valley whenever she can get there. 

Hometown: Bellevue, WA

Bikes: Ibis HD, Cannondale Trigger 27.5, 1980s Ibis tandem with rainbow splatter paint 

Favorite Jackson Ride: Arrow to Phillips Canyon, Putt Putt

Other Sports: Snowboarding, yoga, surfing, stocking firewood

Bucket List Ride: Sweden, Sedona Arizona

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
HOME

AMBASSADORS

Featured
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove

JEFF BRINES

Bikes: Transition Patrol and Transition Smuggler. Depending on the terrain, there are no finer bikes for having the most fun between point "A" and "B".

Words of wisdom: Just remember to keep it fun. That's the whole point of these two wheeled party machines!

Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove

MARK LINARES

Road Bike: My old steel Roberts 1989 spec Campag C Record group with down tube shifters, 24lbs of bliss. I went down the pass on this bike once and hit 63mph. 

Mountain Bikes: I own 5 Niners, you could say I am a fan and none of them are full suspension. Even though it goes against the grain my Niner single speed is the favorite. I love riding, not racing, that bike. Its light, quiet and simple. I am building one up as a totally rigid, again keep it simple.

Words of Wisdom: At my age I find that enjoying what you are doing on your bike is way more gratifying than any results. Even if that is really hard training at times.

Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

AARON NYDHAM

Bikes: Cannondale Habit, Cannondale EVO, Cannondale Scalpel 

Words of Wisdom: "You've got more in you than you think." Kurt Hahn

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

CARY SMITH

Bikes: It's hard for me to pick a favorite bike with so many choices out there. I'd say it depends on my mood. If I want to rip the backyard trails bleeding out of my eyeballs, then the Cannondale FSi is the obvious choice. But if I'm looking to ride downhill irresponsibly fast and get loose, then I grab the Jekyll. For pure, unadulterated fun, the Habit can't be beat. But for almost any race I do, the Scalpel is the fastest tool out there.

Words of Wisdom: One way to keep cycling fresh is to ride with people or in places that will challenge you to improve. The other is to hang out at a bike shop with actual cyclists for employees. Doing both will increase your fitness, skills and list of crude jokes. All of which are important on long rides.

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove

ANDREW WHITEFORD

Bikes:  Ibis Mojo HD3.  It seems every time I get a new bike, it becomes my instant favorite, but this Mojo is a perfect blend of xc adventure bike and full bore crusher for our local trails.  I'm a single bike quiver kind of guy, which allows me to feel completely comfortable on every ride without thinking about having to adapt my riding style to different bikes.

 

Words of Wisdom:  Mix it up!  I definitely have my favorite trails and riding style, but I love studying maps and finding new areas to explore.  I dig the challenge of riding less frequented trails that weren't built to our present standards because it forces me to really focus on the terrain ahead and adjust to whatever comes my way.  It becomes a really fun compliment to riding the trails I know by heart, where I'm able to have a greater focus on speed, technique, or style.  I also recommend going for a hike every once in a while and doing some trail maintenance- which I usually do on a rainy day- so that I can study the trails in a more intimate manner.  After those sessions, I always ride the trail better and carry a greater appreciation for our awesome trail network and all the work that has gone into them.

Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
Jul 11, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove

CARRI WULLNER

Bikes: Cannondale Scalpel, Black Inc

Words of wisdom: Life is short, enjoy it, create what you want and know anything is possible. I hope to keep living the dream for many more years to come!

May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
May 5, 2016 Adam Grove
  
HOME

item.title: RIDES
item.content:encoded: EVENTS

item.title: SERVICES
item.content:encoded:
SERVICES

FIT + DEMO
PERFECT FIT
From wind tunnel testing to spending our life on the roads and trails, we have the most modern technology to help you get your perfect fit!
DEMO
Not sure you want to buy a bike, why not demo? Our staff will fit you with the bike and components right for you so you can enjoy a day in the Tetons.
EXPERIENCE
Our staff is the most experienced in the area with over 25 years fitting and servicing the finest cycles.
Learn More

PRODUCTS

MOUNTAIN + FAT BIKES
For the adrenaline junkie
ROAD BIKES
For the speed demon
ACCESSORIES
HUB merch, components and such
SHOP

item.title: SERVICES
item.content:encoded:
The Fulton Cycle is exactly the bike you need, at precisely the moment when you need it.

 

The Fulton Cycle's quick-connect mounting system and modular accessories allow you to create the bike that you need on the fly, without breaking out the wrench. With a functional 3D-printed steel frame and a built-in cable lock and lighting, the Fulton Cycle is the only bike you'll ever need for city life. Images in this template demo depict the EVO Utility Bike, by Huge Design. Photography by Gauthier Richard.
